Arcane Cascade: Invigorate.name: Arcane Cascade: Invigorate
Arcane Cascade: Invigorate.description:
Trigger You reduce a creature to 0 Hit Points with a spell or Spellstrike.

Requirements You are wielding your black blade.

Grants @UUID[Compendium.magus.magus-effects.Item.Coch9k2QTmKig8Ms]{Effect: Arcane Cascade: Invigorate} (apply both to your PC and your familiar!)

Your black blade becomes invigorated and your melee Strikes with it deal 1 additional damage for 1 minute. This additional damage increases to 2 if you have weapon specialization and 3 if you have greater weapon specialization. This damage is of the same type as the Arcane Cascade stance. Strikes that benefit from this damage gain the arcane trait, making them magical.

If your black blade uses this ability on a creature below your level, you must attempt a Will save against its Ego.

Despite being a minion, your black blade gains 1 reaction at the start of its turns, which it can use for Invigorate and other reaction abilities it gains from being a black blade.

Can't Walk.name: Can't Walk
Can't Walk.description: Your black blade has no land speed.

Constructed Weapon.name: Constructed Weapon
Constructed Weapon.description: Your black blade can be wielded as a weapon and takes the form of a weapon of your choice during your daily preparations. Your black blade cannot be targeted by effects or given Commands while you are wielding it, but it may gain reactions it can use while it is being wielded depending on its abilities. You can etch runes and apply special materials to your black blade, but any property runes that can’t apply to the form of your black blade are suppressed until the item takes a shape to which they can apply. Your black blade is immune to bleed, death effects, disease, doomed, drained, fatigued, healing, necromancy, nonlethal attacks, paralyzed, poison, sickened, and unconscious. It can recover Hit Points only via the Repair action and other methods that fix items, not from any form of Hit Point healing. It's destroyed at 0 HP.

Ego.name: Ego
Ego.description: Your black blade has needs that it must fill, and you must satisfy its undying thirst for power. Your black blade gains an Ego value equal to its Will DC. Whenever you attempt an action that your black blade restricts, either by an ability or via violating its purpose, you must attempt a basic @Check[type:will|dc:resolve(@actor.system.saves.will.dc)] save against your black blade’s ego value or you lose Hit Points equal to your level and your weapon regains Hit Points equal to the Hit Points you lost. If you get a success, you do not have to make Will saves against your black blade’s ego for 1 hour, or 1 day if you got a critical success.

Feed Me.name: Feed Me
Feed Me.description: You have learned to feed your black blade your energy to satisfy its needs. You can spend a single action with the concentrate trait to give your black blade the effects of Invigorate, but you must attempt a Will save against its Ego and you must attempt this save even if you would be immune to its Ego. Your familiar must be a black blade to select this ability.

Life Drinker.name: Life Drinker
Life Drinker.description:
Trigger You critically hit a living creature with your black blade.

Your black blade takes advantage of your tremendous blow and drinks in the life force of the enemy. The triggering creature must attempt a Fortitude save against your spell DC or class DC, whichever is higher.

Critical Success The creature is unaffected.

Success The creature becomes drained 1 and you regain a number of Hit Points equal to the amount of Hit Points the target lost from the drained condition.

Failure As success, but the creature becomes drained 2.

Critical Failure As success, but the creature becomes drained 3.

Your familiar must be a black blade and you must be at least 14th level to select this ability. If your black blade uses this ability on a creature below your level, you must attempt a Will save against its Ego.

Purpose.name: Purpose
Purpose.description: Your black blade has a purpose and an accompanying edict. These may or may not be known to its wielder, subject to GM discretion. If you commit an act that would be against its purpose or fail to follow an edict, you must attempt a Will save against its ego.

They're Mine.name: They're Mine
They're Mine.description:
Trigger You fail a Will save against an effect that would give you the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.yblD8fOR1J8rDwEQ]{Confused}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.9qGBRpbX9NEwtAAr]{Controlled}, or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.feats-srd.Item.5GqjEM22n78Vmdpe]{Focused Fascination} conditions or that would require you to take an action against your will.

Your black blade rolls a Will save against the same effect, replacing your result with its own. If it is under the effects of Invigorate, it gains a status bonus to this save equal to the additional damage it would deal. Your familiar must be a black blade and you must be at least 6th level to select this ability.

Foundry Note As familiars cannot read from master data easily, use @UUID[Compendium.magus.magus-effects.Item.G4SEa7CIZWjwAEOX]{Effect: They're MIne} to represent the status bonus, and adjust it to the value of the extra damage you'd deal with your black blade.
